titleStmt.title: VVit bought at a dear rate. Being a relation of the misery one suffers by being too kind hearted: wishing all people to beware of that undoing quality; and to be frugal and saving, that in aged years, their life may be as comfortable, as in youth it was pleasant and folly. To the tune of, Turn love, I prethee [sic] love turn to me.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, in Vine-street, neer Hatten-Garden.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "If all the world my mind did know ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
